content:
X509SecurityTokenHandler Class

In this Article

Represents a security token handler that processes tokens of type X509SecurityToken. By default, the handler will perform chain-trust validation of the X.509 certificate.

Syntax

Declaration

public class X509SecurityTokenHandler : System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler
  • X509SecurityTokenHandler

Inherited Members

,
Configuration

,

,

,

,

TraceTokenValidationFailure(SecurityToken,String)
,
TraceTokenValidationSuccess(SecurityToken)

Constructors summary

X509SecurityTokenHandler()

Initializes a new instance of the X509SecurityTokenHandler class with default values.
X509SecurityTokenHandler(Boolean)

Initializes a new instance of the X509SecurityTokenHandler class by using a value that indicates whether the certificate should be mapped to a Windows account.
X509SecurityTokenHandler(X509CertificateValidator)

Initializes a new instance of the X509SecurityTokenHandler class by using the specified certificate validator.
X509SecurityTokenHandler(Boolean,X509CertificateValidator)

Initializes a new instance of the X509SecurityTokenHandler class by using a value that indicates whether the certificate should be mapped to a Windows account and the specified certificate validator.

Properties summary

CanValidateToken

Gets a value that indicates whether this handler supports validation of tokens of type X509SecurityToken.
CanWriteToken

Gets a value that indicates whether this handler can write tokens of type X509SecurityToken.
CertificateValidator

Gets or sets the X509CertificateValidator that is used by the current instance.
MapToWindows

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the validating token should be mapped to a Windows account.
TokenType

Gets the Type of the tokens that this handler processes.
WriteXmlDSigDefinedClauseTypes

Gets or Sets the value that specifies whether XmlDsig-defined clause types are preferred.
X509NTAuthChainTrustValidator

Gets or sets the X509NTAuthChainTrustValidator that is used by the current instance during certificate validation when the incoming X.509 certificate is mapped to a Windows account.

Methods summary

CanReadKeyIdentifierClause(XmlReader)

Returns a value that indicates whether the specified reader is referring to an <ds:X509Data> element.
CanReadToken(XmlReader)

Returns a value that indicates whether the reader points to an X.509 security token as defined in the WS-Security specification.
CanWriteKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityKeyIdentifierClause)

Returns a value that indicates whether the specified key identifier clause can be serialized by this handler.
GetTokenTypeIdentifiers()

Gets the X.509 security token type defined in the WS-Security X.509 Token Profile.
LoadCustomConfiguration(XmlNodeList)

Loads custom configuration from XML.
ReadKeyIdentifierClause(XmlReader)

Deserializes a key identifier clause referenced by the specified XML reader.
ReadToken(XmlReader)

Deserializes the X.509 security token referenced by the specified XML reader.
ValidateToken(SecurityToken)

Validates the specified X.509 security token.
WriteKeyIdentifierClause(XmlWriter,SecurityKeyIdentifierClause)

Serializes the specified key identifier clause to the XML writer.
WriteToken(XmlWriter,SecurityToken)

Serializes the specified X.509 security token to the specified XML writer.

Constructors

  • X509SecurityTokenHandler()

    Initializes a new instance of the X509SecurityTokenHandler class with default values.

    public X509SecurityTokenHandler ();

    Remarks

    The MapToWindows property is set to false and the PeerOrChainTrust validator is used as the default certificate validator.

  • X509SecurityTokenHandler(Boolean)

    Initializes a new instance of the X509SecurityTokenHandler class by using a value that indicates whether the certificate should be mapped to a Windows account.

    public X509SecurityTokenHandler (bool mapToWindows);

    Parameters

    • mapToWindows
      Boolean

      true if the certificate should be mapped to a Windows account; otherwise, false. Sets the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler.MapToWindows* property.

    Remarks

    The PeerOrChainTrust validator is used as the default certificate validator.

  • X509SecurityTokenHandler(X509CertificateValidator)

    Initializes a new instance of the X509SecurityTokenHandler class by using the specified certificate validator.

    public X509SecurityTokenHandler (System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509CertificateValidator certificateValidator);

    Parameters

    • certificateValidator
      X509CertificateValidator

      The certificate validator to use. Sets the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler.CertificateValidator* property.

    Remarks

    The MapToWindows property is set to false.

  • X509SecurityTokenHandler(Boolean,X509CertificateValidator)

    Initializes a new instance of the X509SecurityTokenHandler class by using a value that indicates whether the certificate should be mapped to a Windows account and the specified certificate validator.

    public X509SecurityTokenHandler (bool mapToWindows, System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509CertificateValidator certificateValidator);

    Parameters

    • mapToWindows
      Boolean

      true if the certificate should be mapped to a Windows account; otherwise, false. Sets the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler.MapToWindows* property.

    • certificateValidator
      X509CertificateValidator

      The certificate validator to use. Sets the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler.CertificateValidator* property.

Properties

  • CanValidateToken

    Gets a value that indicates whether this handler supports validation of tokens of type X509SecurityToken.

    public override bool CanValidateToken { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the handler supports validation of tokens of type X509SecurityToken; otherwise, false. Always true.

  • CanWriteToken

    Gets a value that indicates whether this handler can write tokens of type X509SecurityToken.

    public override bool CanWriteToken { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the handler can write tokens of type X509SecurityToken; otherwise, false. Always true.

  • CertificateValidator

    Gets or sets the X509CertificateValidator that is used by the current instance.

    public System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509CertificateValidator CertificateValidator { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • X509CertificateValidator

      The X.509 certificate validator that is used by the current instance.

  • MapToWindows

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the validating token should be mapped to a Windows account.

    public bool MapToWindows { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the validating token should be mapped to a Windows account; otherwise, false.

  • TokenType

    Gets the Type of the tokens that this handler processes.

    public override Type TokenType { get; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      By default, the type of the X509SecurityToken class.

  • WriteXmlDSigDefinedClauseTypes

    Gets or Sets the value that specifies whether XmlDsig-defined clause types are preferred.

    public bool WriteXmlDSigDefinedClauseTypes { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if XmlDsig-defined clause types are preferred; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Supported XmlDSig-defined SecurityKeyIdentifierClause types are:

    • X509IssuerSerial

    • X509SKI

    • X509Certificate

  • X509NTAuthChainTrustValidator

    Gets or sets the X509NTAuthChainTrustValidator that is used by the current instance during certificate validation when the incoming X.509 certificate is mapped to a Windows account.

    public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509NTAuthChainTrustValidator X509NTAuthChainTrustValidator { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • X509NTAuthChainTrustValidator

      An X.509 certificate validator that will validate a specified X.509 certificate and verify whether the certificate can be mapped to a Windows account and whether the certificate chain is trusted.

Methods

  • CanReadKeyIdentifierClause(XmlReader)

    Returns a value that indicates whether the specified reader is referring to an <ds:X509Data> element.

    public override bool CanReadKeyIdentifierClause (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);

    Parameters

    • reader
      XmlReader

      An XML reader positioned at the start element of the key identifier clause.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the reader is referring to an <ds:X509Data> element; otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      reader is null.

  • CanReadToken(XmlReader)

    Returns a value that indicates whether the reader points to an X.509 security token as defined in the WS-Security specification.

    public override bool CanReadToken (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);

    Parameters

    • reader
      XmlReader

      A reader pointing to the token XML.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the reader is pointing to an X.509 security token; otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      reader is null.

  • CanWriteKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityKeyIdentifierClause)

    Returns a value that indicates whether the specified key identifier clause can be serialized by this handler.

    public override bool CanWriteKeyIdentifierClause (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause securityKeyIdentifierClause);

    Parameters

    • securityKeyIdentifierClause
      SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

      The key identifier clause to be serialized.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the securityKeyIdentifierClause is supported and if the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler.WriteXmlDSigDefinedClauseTypes* property is set to true; otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      securityKeyIdentifierClause is null.

    Remarks

    The supported key identifier clause types are:

    1. X509IssuerSerialKeyIdentifierClause
    2. X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause
    3. X509SubjectKeyIdentifierClause
  • GetTokenTypeIdentifiers()

    Gets the X.509 security token type defined in the WS-Security X.509 Token Profile.

    public override string[] GetTokenTypeIdentifiers ();

    Returns

    • String[]

      The X.509 token type URI. By default, the value of the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenTypes.X509Certificate* property.

  • LoadCustomConfiguration(XmlNodeList)

    Loads custom configuration from XML.

    public override void LoadCustomConfiguration (System.Xml.XmlNodeList customConfigElements);

    Parameters

    • customConfigElements
      XmlNodeList

      The XML elements that contain the custom configuration.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      customConfigElements is null.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The custom configuration specified is not valid.

  • ReadKeyIdentifierClause(XmlReader)

    Deserializes a key identifier clause referenced by the specified XML reader.

    public override System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause ReadKeyIdentifierClause (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);

    Parameters

    • reader
      XmlReader

      The XML reader referencing the key identifier clause.

    Returns

    • SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

      The key identifier clause that was deserialized from the XML.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      reader is null.

  • ReadToken(XmlReader)

    Deserializes the X.509 security token referenced by the specified XML reader.

    public override System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken ReadToken (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);

    Parameters

    • reader
      XmlReader

      An XML reader that is pointing to an X.509 security token.

    Returns

    • SecurityToken

      The security token deserialized from the XML. An instance of X509SecurityToken.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      reader is null.

    • XmlException

      reader is not pointing to a valid X.509 security token as defined in the WS-Security X.509 Token Profile. Or the encodingType specified is other than Base64 or HexBinary.

  • ValidateToken(SecurityToken)

    Validates the specified X.509 security token.

    public override System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity> ValidateToken (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken token);

    Parameters

    • token
      SecurityToken

      The token to be validated.

    Returns

    • ReadOnlyCollection<ClaimsIdentity>

      The identities contained in the token.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      token is not assignable from X509SecurityToken.

    • ArgumentNullException

      token is null.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler.Configuration* property is null.

      -or-

      There is no issuer name registry (IssuerNameRegistry) configured. (The stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration.IssuerNameRegistry* property of the SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration referenced by the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler.Configuration* property is null.)

    • SecurityTokenValidationException

      The current X509CertificateValidator was unable to validate the certificate in the token.

    • SecurityTokenException

      The current IssuerNameRegistry returned null when trying to resolve the issuer of the certificate in the token.

  • WriteKeyIdentifierClause(XmlWriter,SecurityKeyIdentifierClause)

    Serializes the specified key identifier clause to the XML writer.

    public override void WriteKeyIdentifierClause (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause securityKeyIdentifierClause);

    Parameters

    • writer
      XmlWriter

      The XML writer to which the key identifier clause should be serialized.

    • securityKeyIdentifierClause
      SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

      The key identifier clause to serialize.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      securityKeyIdentifierClause is null.

      -or-

      writer is null.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler.WriteXmlDSigDefinedClauseTypes* property is false.

  • WriteToken(XmlWriter,SecurityToken)

    Serializes the specified X.509 security token to the specified XML writer.

    public override void WriteToken (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken token);

    Parameters

    • writer
      XmlWriter

      The XML writer to which the token should be serialized.

    • token
      SecurityToken

      The X.509 security token to serialize. An instance of X509SecurityToken.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      token is null.

      -or-

      writer is null.

    • ArgumentException

      token is not assignable from X509SecurityToken.

rawMetadata.description: Represents a security token handler that processes tokens of type . By default, the handler will perform chain-trust validation of the X.509 certificate.
